articles.title: Health workers leading by example this World Hand Hygiene Day - WHO/Europe
articles.description: We spoke to 2 nurses about the simple, but critically important practice of cleaning hands and found out why hand hygiene is so important in the health-care environment.

articles.title: SpaceX astronauts depart ISS for Earth - The West Australian
articles.description: The SpaceX Crew Dragon capsule carrying three US NASA astronauts and a German astronaut from the European Space Agency is on its way home to Earth from the ISS.

articles.title: Health emergencies - Q&A on hepatitis in children - WHO/Europe
articles.description: In recent weeks, a number of cases of severe hepatitis of unknown origin in children have been reported. These have been detected in several countries including the United Kingdom of Great Britain and Northern Ireland, Spain and the United States of America.

articles.description: Highlights: Russia's defense ministry said its forces had struck a military airfield near the Black Sea port of Odesa with missiles destroying drones, missiles and ammunition supplied to Ukraine by the United States and its European allies.

articles.title: EU proposes Russian oil ban to make Putin 'pay high price' for Ukraine - CBC News
articles.description: The European Union's executive on Wednesday proposed the toughest package of sanctions yet against Moscow for its war in Ukraine, but several countries worried about the impact of cutting off Russia oil imports stood in the way of agreement.

articles.title: After India-Nordic Summit, PM Modi Meets French Prez Macron in Paris - The Quint
articles.description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi, who is on a 3-day visit to Europe, attended the second India-Nordic summit in Denmark's capital Copenhagen on Wednesday, 4 May. He is expected to meet French President Emmanuel Macron in Paris later on Wednesday.

articles.title: UN: Obesity levels in Europe at ‘epidemic proportions’ - Kathimerini English Edition
articles.description: The World Health Organization says the rates of people who are obese and overweight in Europe have hit “epidemic proportions,” with nearly 60% of adults and a third of children in one of those categories.

articles.author: Antony Ashkenaz
articles.title: NASA sends warning as 'strong' solar flare batters Earth – Europe hit with ‘blackouts’ - Express
articles.description: NASA's Solar Dynamics Observatory (SDO) captured an image of a major solar flare that caused blackouts over Europe and the Atlantic Ocean.
